intro: Clarkia purpurea subsp. viminea, commonly known as the purple clarkia, is a flowering plant native to California and Oregon. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers. The subspecies viminea typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with fine hairs, while the stems are slender and branching. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
